source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: This specification shall be read in conjunction with all relevant Irish standards and codes of practice, Irish building regulations, technical guidance documents to the Irish building regulation, NSAI - National Rules for Electrical Installations, IS10101:2020+A1:2024.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The requirements of these documents shall be fully adhered to by the sub-contractor in his execution of the sub-contract works.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: In the event of there being any conflict between the requirements of this specification and any of the above-mentioned Republic of Ireland documents, the requirements of the Republic of Ireland documents shall prevail over those of this specification.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The sub-contractor shall, giving adequate notice before taking any particular course of action, inform the architect of any such disagreement in the documentation and as the project progresses.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Adequate notice shall never be less than the one week.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: This specification shall be read in conjunction with the relevant drawings.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: In the event of there being any conflict between the drawings & specifications, the contractor shall allow for the most onerous option when submitting a tender.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The installation shall comply fully with ESB Standards.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Consideration shall be given to future operation and maintenance of the system so that replacement of major components can be achieved in shortest time with minimum disruption to the Building.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All equipment installed shall be new and meet the ESB specifications where applicable Initial contacts have been made with the ESB regarding the provision of the required supply, and it has been agreed that two new substations will be constructed to feed the building development.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The electrical contractor shall be responsible for liaison and co-ordination, with the ESB to complete all of the works.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The electrical contractor shall be responsible for ensuring that all ESB works are scheduled and complete to allow commissioning of the building including all mechanical services and to ensure that the building can be handed over in accordance with the main contract programme.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The electrical contractor shall schedule a meeting with the ESB before ordering switchgear equipment or commencing works to discuss the entire installation proposed.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Any necessary attendance of the ESB or their Contractors shall be provided by the Contractor.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The contractor shall note the requirement for the Client for the selection of customer agreement connection to an Electricity Vendor and shall advise of connection programme to ensure that such agreements are in place as required to ensure power on dates are achieved.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Application for additional telephone lines and services other than those for the alarm systems shall be by the client.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The contractor shall make all necessary applications for lines required to complete commissioning i.e.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchboards shall be manufactured, factory assembled and tested by a specialist switchboard manufacturer.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: They shall comply with IEC EN 60439-1 with a minimum ingress protection of IP44.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchboards shall be Form 4 type 2 unless otherwise specified and shall be provided with the facility to extend the switchboard at one end.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The areas available for switchboards and sub boards together with the proposed routes and details of all incoming and outgoing cables relative to the switchboard shall be checked by the Contractor to ensure that they are adequate for the equipment proposed by the Tenderer.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchboards shall be flush fronted, cubicle type.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: They shall be self-supporting with cubicle tops, side panels and doors constructed from a minimum of 1.5mm thick sheet metal.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Frames shall be at least 2.5mm thick and shall provide a rigid construction without cross bracing.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The switchboard shall be of uniform height and depth throughout its length.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Hinges shall be of concealed type.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Busbars shall be separated from all functional units and their terminals by metal enclosures.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Metalwork shall be finished to withstand local climatic conditions.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Doors, lids and removable panels shall be fitted with suitable gaskets to prevent ingress of moisture and insects.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All units shall be provided with locking devices, either suited or key lock.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Incoming and outgoing cables shall be terminated via a removable gland plate fitted to the bottom of the switchboard unless the type of cable requires specific treatment.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The gland termination shall maintain the IP3X protection.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Where single core armoured cables are to be terminated into a gland plate, it shall be of a suitable non-ferrous material.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The main metering panel switchboard shall be mounted on 100mm deep channel iron plinth.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The metering panel shall be capable of future extension.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchboard construction shall be designed to take into account all heat dissipating equipment, including external influences, such as busbar flanges from encapsulated busbar.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Where specified the switchboard construction shall be designed to incorporate the neutral earth link, which shall be housed within a dedicated cubicle.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The neutral earth link cubicle shall be lockable and clearly labelled.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All protection and measurement CT’s shall be housed within a cubicle of the panel construction, not within the transformer enclosure.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Insulating rubber matting complying with BS 921-1976, extending the length of each switchboard at the front and, where accessible, the rear shall be provided.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Within each switch room a framed and glazed "Treatment for Electric Shock" notice shall be provided and fixed to the wall in prominent position.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Each complete switchboard shall have the current rating specified.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Fuse-switches shall be provided with high breaking capacity fuses complying with BS 88 and BSEN 60269, having a rupture capacity of not less than the associated switchgear.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Fuse-switches shall be equipped with a cable box, gland and clamp for XPLE or LSF cable or with an end plate suitable for drilling to suit MI cable gland or conduit entry.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The gaseous products of arc extinction shall not be allowed to impair the operation of switchgear.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Arcing within any cubicle, including terminals; shall be confined so that it does not affect the operation of circuits in adjacent cubicles.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The design of the equipment shall incorporate a method of venting any ionizing gases resulting from a fault safely to high level away from the operator.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The main incoming device shall be provided in a separate cubicle for each supply.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The device shall be arranged so that all incoming supplies, including control circuits, are isolated within the appropriate compartment.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: A copper earth bar shall be bolted to the main switchboard frame and run the full length of the switchboard, with the cubicles solidly bonded to it.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Provision shall be made at the end of the bar for Electrical Particular Scope of Works Page 11 of 44 connection to the main earthing system.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The main earth bar or a tee-off connection shall be located convenient to the cable gland plates to permit the earth bonding of all cable glands.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The main earth bar and tee-off connection shall not be smaller than 300 sq./mm for switchboards protected by air circuit breakers.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Each individual panel of the switchboard shall be provided with thermostatically controlled anti- condensation heaters, energized from a 240V, 50Hz, single-phase supply.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The heaters shall be fused and switched in groups with the switches and fuses being mounted on individual panels to the agreement of the Engineer.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The switchboard shall be complete with cable boxes, meters and ancillary equipment before the switchboards are certified for dispatch at the manufacturer’s works.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The switchboards shall be installed, tested and commissioned strictly in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Adequate clearance shall be provided around the equipment to allow safe access for maintenance and means of escape.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The switchboard shall be installed in dry, dust free conditions and onto a prepared level surface.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Prior to the installation of the equipment, the walls and ceiling shall receive two coats of clear sealer and the floor two coats of light grey concrete floor paint.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Following the completion of the installation works the LV switchboards shall be left in clean, dry conditions with covers fitted and where necessary, any additional protection in place to protect the equipment until such time as commissioning may commence.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: An electronic ammeter and voltmeter shall be provided on the main incoming device.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: They shall be provided with scales of a range suitable for the capacity of the switchboard.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Each meter shall be provided with a phase selector and off switch so that readings of all phases, including neutral current and voltage between phases may be obtained.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Meters shall be flush mounted at or near eye level.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Meters shall be provided to monitor maximum demand and energy consumption.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: They shall be complete with auxiliary contacts and shall provide a 0 - 10V output over a scale of 0 to full-scale deflection, to facilitate monitoring from a BMS.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All meters, instrumentation and protection devices shall be ergonomically positioned to ensure that displays and controls are easily accessible and viewable.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Digital multi-meters shall be provided providing the following functions: - • Volts (v) • Amps (A) • Frequency (f) • Power Factor (pf) • Active Power (kW) • Apparent Power (kVA) • Reactive Power (kVA) • Kilo watt hours (kWhr) • Kilo volt ampere hours (kVAhr) • Maximum demand (kVA) The digital multi-meters shall be provided with a plug-in communications module, to allow each instrument to be interfaced with a BMS/EMS.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The protocol selected for the communications module shall be coordinated with the BMS/EMS equipment supplier.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchgear Type: - Sheet steel cubicle - Busbars as per main Breaker Capacity Voltage: 400/230V, 3 Phase Assembly: - Floor Mounted - All panel sections providing direct access to live assemblies shall be openable only with a special tool Switchboard Classification: Form 4a compartmentalised in accordance with IS EN 61439-2 Circuit Breakers: LSI Relay Enclosure Protection: IP41 Enclosure Fire Rating: 60 minutes

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Switchgear Type: - Sheet steel cubicle - Busbars as per main Breaker Capacity Voltage: 400/230V, 3 Phase Assembly: - Floor Mounted - All panel sections providing direct access to live assemblies shall be openable only with a special tool Switchboard Classification: Form 4b compartmentalised in accordance with IS EN 61439-2 Enclosure Protection: IP41 Enclosure Fire Rating: 60 minutes

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All landlord sub distribution boards and MCC’s shall have energy meters installed.
context: 25 % spare capacity to be left on all main & sub main distribution boards.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The meters shall provide readings for the following loadings: • Current kVA demand • Max kVA demand • kWh The meters shall have a pulsed output/Modbus for integration into the BMS System.
context: 25 % spare capacity to be left on all main & sub main distribution boards.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The contractor shall supply, install, test and commission a complete earthing and bonding system in accordance with the NSAI - National Rules for Electrical Installations, IS10101:2020+A1:2024.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: A TN-C-S earthing system shall be employed on the site i.e.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The Contractor shall supply and install a complete earthing system to effectively and safety earth all metal work, containment, electrical equipment including cable sheaths, cable support systems, lighting, switches and sockets outlets on the site.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The contractor shall form an equipotential zone within the buildings to provide protection against indirect contact, by bonding all extraneous and exposed conductive parts to the main earth terminal.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Main Equipotential Bonding: LSF/cu main equipotential bonding conductors shall be installed between the earth bars and all extraneous and exposed conductive parts including but not limited to the following: • Mains cold water pipes • DHWS pipes • Heating flow and return pipes • Gas pipes • Ducting • Mechanical installation control panel • Panel boards and distribution earth bars Electrical Particular Scope of Works Page 15 of 44 Supplementary bonding: The contractor shall ensure all metal sinks, associated hot and cold water pipes, metal waste pipes and metal worktops and radiators are bonded together.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Metal sheaths of armour of all cables shall be bonded to the earth bar of the connected electrical equipment with appropriately sized LSF/cu cables.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: XLPE/SWA/LSZH insulated cables shall be manufactured to comply with BS 6724 and IEC 60502.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: They shall be of minimum 1000 volt grade unless otherwise specified, with standard sector shaped conductors.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The conductors shall be stranded and each insulated with an LSF sheath.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Sheathed conductors shall be covered with an overall LSF extrusion to form bedding for the single galvanized steel wire armouring.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: The whole shall be covered with an extruded black LSF sheath of the flame retardant type where the cable is installed within buildings.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All cables must be CPR compliant.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: XLPE/SWA/LSZH insulated cables shall be terminated by compression type gunmetal or brass glands constructed to grip both the inner and outer sheath and so designed that any strain on the cable is taken by the steel wire armouring which shall be effectively bonded to the gland.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Glands shall incorporate an effective seal between the gland itself and the outer cable sheath.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Glands shall be weather and moisture proof and complete with LSF shrouds.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All cables shall be concealed within the building fabric i.e.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Sub-main cables through-out shall be fixed to heavy duty cable trays or alloy cable ladders suspended from the ceiling slab and walls of risers.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Cable bends shall be in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: All cables shall be supported in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendation and to ensure that they are not exposed to undue mechanical strain on the conductors or terminations.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: PVC tie wraps shall not be acceptable as any part of a fixing method.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
rule_text: Where cables drop from ceiling voids to distribution boards, they shall be enclosed within manufacturer’s painted steel trunking separate to that installed for final sub-circuit wiring.

source_doc: EDC - ELECTRICAL PARTICULAR SCOPE OF WORKS.pdf
